instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: MBPr Tbar <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Does not charge through or recognize Apple USB-C Hub/Adapter.
threads.message: Originally liquid damage around UB300. Did not power on originally. After ultrasonic the board came out clean. No charred components, or burnt pads/traces. After replacing the both UB300 and UB400 got everything back to working. Charges with normal USB-C cable. Behaves normally in the operating system. BUT this thing will not recognize any USB-C Hub. Apple or Otherwise. Will not charge through the USB-C Hub. (Confirmed known working hubs.) DC-In stays at 5V through the hub. I am not really sure what could be effecting the this since regular charging is working. Any ideas?

threads.title: MBPr Tbar <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Does not charge through or recognize Apple USB-C Hub/Adapter.
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_X_USBC</SIGNAL> was not being created on either side. Replaced both chips and mosfets. good to go.

threads.title: MBPr Tbar <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Does not charge through or recognize Apple USB-C Hub/Adapter.
